website_summaries.verdict: The top-end gaming and professional motherboard in the ASUS Prime series.
pros: High-end construction and durability with the ability to mount high-quality components
Comes with built-in heat sensors to keep the parts cool while working
cons: Some motherboard kits may come with missing mounting screws and other small parts

customer_reviews.title: Bugged firmware/BIOS that isn’t fixed still
customer_reviews.text: Myself and many others have experienced an issue every other reboot or so— a single core on your CPU will stay at 100% usage, due to ACPI.sys in Windows. Microsoft engineers have confirmed via traces that this is a result of a bug on ASUS’s end. I wish so badly I could get my money back for this motherboard but it’s too late.
customer_reviews.author: N. Head

customer_reviews.title: great board,
customer_reviews.text: great board,, I sent my first one back,, bent pins,, and received a new board almost overnight. there are so many things I can do with this,, I have about 5 settings for overclocks on my 7900x... I really want to use my u.2 connector and am running a 1tb evo pci nvme. this is excellent for boot .. then 2 Samsung 512 ssds, im trying to decide how best to buy a u.2 for it,, but that intell stuff really is expensive. I am very happy with this motherboard and the service being a prime member certainly pays off.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mojabo

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Not ready for Prime time. I installed an Intel Core i9-7900X Processor and 64 gb's of DDR4. Blue screens of death. Starts after several attempts, but once it is on, it stays on. I finally got to the point where I can not start it at all. When it worked it was great, but I expected much more from company I've been loyal too for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Joemac516

customer_reviews.title: A Great Motherboard
customer_reviews.text: This is one beautiful motherboard. It works flawlessly. The RGB LEDs really make it look pretty in its case.
customer_reviews.author: Rooke

customer_reviews.title: but enough to annoy me because you have to kinda look up at ...
customer_reviews.text: The build in OLED Display is not aligned right, it's crooked. Not much, but enough to annoy me because you have to kinda look up at an angle to see the tops of the letters. Another thing, which I just overlooked, there is only one usb2.0 header, so can't link my corsair psu and water cooler at the same time to monitor everything like power consumption.
customer_reviews.author: Miah

customer_reviews.title: Excellent minus one tiny flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Great motherboard for making sure I know what is going on in my computer. It however could use another input for hooking up a AIO cooling unit line so the bios can read it not enough ports to work with and that is my only issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mech Man

customer_reviews.title: Fast and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have this motherboard tricked out with m.2 drives, 32GB of memory and an i9 Intel processor. Works great. Reliable and fast. My only wish is that when a new BIOS is installed, the settings from the old one would be remembered.
customer_reviews.author: AbeK

customer_reviews.title: and I butcher the board to remove ASUS's poor hardware choices
customer_reviews.text: I havent even been able to power this little bugger on, and already I have a deep abiding hatred for it. The "M.2 Heat shield as they call it, is fastened by 3 TINY screws. Which The factory graciously decided to Locktite. So of course, screw head stripped immediately. Now cannot use M.2 slot until the screw extractor set arrives, and I butcher the board to remove ASUS's poor hardware choices. Add to that the utter lack of mounting screws or hardware, and I arrive at the decision that I probably should have just gone with a far cheaper board of a competitor, especially since Asus the board this is replacing FRIED after a few months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: it works fine. The side USB 3
customer_reviews.text: This is the latest Mobo from Asus, but I burn it while installing. Trying to plug and USB connector to the side header on the mobo, a pin bent and touched another, it completely fried. I could not start the system since then and have to get a new one, it works fine. The side USB 3.0 header need to be relocated, it is very hard to connect a cable once it is installed on the case.
customer_reviews.author: Jairo Lugo

customer_reviews.title: This is my first Intel board in like 5 years and I must say if they keep ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Intel board in like 5 years and I must say if they keep up with this quality of motherboard in the future I might just spend the extra money for Intel stuff
customer_reviews.author: ethan

customer_reviews.title: motherboard
customer_reviews.text: loved except the second m.2 slot you have to use a riser comes with you motherboard I used it with Core i5 x series
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad Doumani

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: First one came with a broken/disconnected OLED. Replacement has no issues and performs very well.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce P

customer_reviews.title: Amazon is amazing!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg it is so beautiful. I cannot wait to use it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ezequiel

customer_reviews.title: Great board but......
customer_reviews.text: Great board.....if you don’t have any USB 2.0 devices. For some reason the geniuses at ASUS decided to only put one 2.0 header on the board. Though the board is solid I’m completely disappointed in it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pasich

customer_reviews.title: The features of this board are greatly appreciated and useful. I was a bit worried due to all ...
customer_reviews.text: So far there are no problems from my use and it performs exactly as I expect it to. The features of this board are greatly appreciated and useful. I was a bit worried due to all the complaints of the non-working/rushed out the factory boards, but my assurance in ASUS has never slipped and they did not fail me now.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Received an old used motherboard.
customer_reviews.text: I received a package with an old asus motherboard in it. I couldn't contain my laughter as I opened the package to see lint and dust covering an ancient asus.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Jackson

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE W SAMSUNG 960 m.2 SSD & WIN10!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT USE this board with samsung 960 m.2 ssd Windows 10. Just google "x299 and samsung 960". BSOD if you try to update windows. Been an issue for months and no one has a fix yet as of Oct. 29th. Was recently called out in CNET article. Ive always been a fan of asus, and put about $3,000 worth of their gear into this one build. Very disappointed. UPDATE: More issues with this mobo. I used the overclocking functionality (EZ mode) and tried setting back to default but the board hangs of post w load vga bios error. Basically, the mobo is a paperweight now. Current firmware, nothing crazy. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Fake reviews on here so here she the facts. The thunder bold dose not work When you install drivers for any video card they instantly stop sending a signal to the screen. I have tested this with a 1080 gtx and a rx580 ever thing works till the video cards real drives are installed them screen shuts off. Even though the thunderbolt comes with the mobo they will not warranty it. Do not waist your $
customer_reviews.author: Sean Spangler, CTPO

customer_reviews.title: Unstable x299 chipset, problematic motherboard
customer_reviews.text: I am using the system with intel core i7 7820x processor and gskill trident z rgb 3000 MHz 4x8 ram. The x299 chipset is definitely not stable, I often see freezing, blue screen faults and fps drops in games. I tried all the bios versions, I made the RAM memtest. No problem with dual channel tests, the system freezes when I run quad channel. It takes more time for x299. I regret.
customer_reviews.author: Arif S.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Pixx Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product at Newegg.com, but they won't let me edit my original review on their site after the manufacturer responds to the review. First X299-Deluxe board I received wouldn't post and I was unable to reflash the BIOS. RMA'd and received a replacement after about two weeks. Replacement board didn't even get completely unboxed, but it was obvious that the heralded "Liveview" OLED display was completely missing from the front of the board! Doesn't anybody at ASUS even look at these boards before they go out the door! Horrendous quality control. Always purchased ASUS in the past, but no longer. I may never get this computer built if they just keep shipping me defective replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Darin Lasater

customer_reviews.title: Excellent motherboard for the new i9
customer_reviews.text: I used the motherboard to build a custom PC. Well build and packed with the latest tech. Do not upgrade the BIOS unless you absolutely have to!!! Version 0702 2017/08/18 works well for me. It has the SKL-X CPU MicroCode fix... Works flawlessly with the following components: Intel i9: Memory Corsair : SSD Samsung 960pro: Power supply (Corsair 850): CPU cooler: The SSD heatsink is useless and the SSD works better without it. Setting up RAID 1 on the motherboard is very hard...
customer_reviews.author: Ogi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome motherboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this motherboard two months ago to replace my aging X79 system. Previously I used a Gigabyte X79-UP4 and I was not satisfied with its overclocking abilities. The new X299 Prime Deluxe definitely deserves the luxury name as it's very smart and capable for overclocking. ASUS engineered a wonderful and robust X299 motherboard with terrific sound quality and tweaking options. I can easily overclock my i7 7820X to 4.73Ghz and get Cinebench scores clearly above 2030 for the CPU. Everything works smoothly ! The bios is relatively easy to work with and it has geek level refinements. Way to go ASUS ! (The only problem is that this motherboard is expensive..)
customer_reviews.author: DV

customer_reviews.title: I like this board
customer_reviews.text: I like this board. But i have big troubles with the speed of my two SSD-Disk. CrystalDiskMark shows only 240/270 R/W MBs. That is more than a half of the normal speed. The Asus Support can't help me and must send it back to my seller. The boot time is also very slow, over one minute. I hope it is a single case.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Egli

customer_reviews.title: Have just purchased despite bad reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Have just purchased despite bad reviews..had it professionally installed with 7800 intel i7 chip...total disaster..didnt boot and couldn't read ram input...put another totally new board didnt engage operating system..i think it's a manufacture issue as other reviews on this particular chip...buyer be warned not to buy...again I bought 2 totally new mbs..and had failures
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DOA worst quality control and beyond worst on customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival, the last asus motherboard I own was send back for rma in less then one year. I've built my pc for the last 24 years with asus motherboard, but this is the last asus product I'm going to buy. Their technical support will keep you on the phone for hours before it can send back for rma. If you don't have a life with a lot of money and time to burn, this is the motherboard for you.
customer_reviews.author: jase

customer_reviews.title: Excellent motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Excellent built quality, stable, cool, thunderbolt 3 enabled Make sure bios is most current, as ThunderboltEX 3 was unstable, as well as cpu(7820X) After bios update, everything has been rock solid
customer_reviews.author: Amy D.

product_meta.title: ASUS Prime X299-DELUXE LGA2066 DDR4 M.2 U.2 Thunderbolt 3 USB 3.1 X299 ATX Motherboard with Dual Gigabit LAN and 802.11AD WiFi for Intel Core X-Series Processors
product_meta.description: Size:ATX| Style:Prime X299-DeluxeThe ASUS PRIME X299-DELUXE is the prime choice for prosumers and content creators with 1-click overclocking from 5-Way Optimization, ASUS Pro Clock Technology, and multiple GPU support featuring SafeSlot protection. Maximize connectivity speeds with Thunderbolt3, U.2 and Dual M.2, front-panel USB 3.1, Dual Intel Gigabit LAN, and on-board 802.11AD/AC WIFI.
feature_bullets: Designed for 7th generation LGA2066 socket Intel Core X-Series processors to maximize connectivity and speed with U.2 port, dual M.2, Thunderbolt EX 3, front panel USB 3.1, onboard 802.11AC/AD WIFI and Intel Optane Memory compatibility
5-Way Optimization with Auto-Tuning and FanXpert 4 automatically tailors overclocking profiles to your unique build for maximum OC performance and dynamic system cooling

Patent-pending SafeSlot (3X) features an injection molding process that integrates metal framing for a stronger, firmly anchored PCIe slot built for heavyweight GPUs. Operating System: Windows 10 64-bit

Supports dual band frequency 2.4/5 GHz+ 60GHz, up to 4600Mbps transfer speed. Unmatched Personalization with ASUS exclusive AURA Sync RGB lighting, additional RGB header and 3D-printing mounts to customize your build
Industry-leading 8-channel HD audio enhanced by ASUS exclusive Realtek S1220A featuring Crystal Sound 3 and driven by Japanese capacitors for warm, immersive sound

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars66 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
